banner.title: Decentralized Governance for Everyone
banner.description: A complete multi-chain blockchain governance platform for DAOs, projects, and institutions seeking transparency, security, and efficiency in their decision-making processes.

whyChooseUs.title: Why Choose Our Platform?
whyChooseUs.subtitle: A complete solution for decentralized governance focused on transparency, security, and ease of use.

features.title: Total Transparency
features.description: All decisions and votes are recorded on the blockchain, ensuring full auditability.

features.title: Easy Implementation
features.description: Ready-to-use whitelabel system, adaptable to your organization's needs.

features.title: Security First
features.description: Advanced protection and multi-layer verification for all operations.

features.title: Expert Support
features.description: A technical team ready to assist with platform implementation and usage.

features.title: Multi-Chain
features.description: Support for multiple blockchains, starting with Cardano and expanding to other networks.

features.title: Voting System
features.description: Transparent and auditable voting process with permanent record on the blockchain.

features.title: DRep Management
features.description: Complete system for delegate representatives with accountability.

features.title: Analytics
features.description: Dashboards and detailed analyses for tracking proposals and votes.

features.title: Discussions
features.description: Space for community debate and interaction on proposals.

features.title: Security
features.description: Advanced protection and complete auditability of all operations.

announcementBar.alertText: This site is under development and will be officially launched on February 10, 2025.
announcementBar.feedbackText: This site is under constant development, but we would like to hear your feedback to improve it. Take the survey!

newsletter.newsletterDescription: Building Together to Drive Cardano Forward.

pageDreps.longDescription: Delegated Representatives (DReps) are ADA holders who registered on-chain to allow other members of the community to delegate their voting power to them, so that they can vote on their behalf. They are are like 'parlimentary representatives' in the Governance system.
pageDreps.search: Search DReps by name or ID

pageGovernanceActions.longDescription: Anyone that has ADA in a wallet can propose a Governace Action. To submit a Governance Action, the submitter pays a refundable deposit of 100,000 Ada. The deposit will be returned automatically back to the submitter's wallet upon completion of the Voting period.

pageGovernanceActionsDetails.votesSubmittedBy: Votes submitted for this Governance Action By

pageProposals.longDescription: Participate in discussions and decision-making processes guided by community governance.

pageProposalsDetails.longDescription: Participate in discussions and decision-making processes guided by community governance.

pageCommittees.longDescription: Meet the Cardano community members who are participating in all existing committees.

pageLiveEvents.longDescription: See all governance events in real time.

pageAnalytics.governanceDelegationDesc: ADA taking part in Governance as of today by category in relation to the circulating supply of ADA on Cardano.

pageHelp.longDescription: All-in-One Governance Platform. Cardano Voltaire CIP-1694 Offical Transparency & Community Portal.
pageHelp.question11: Ways to use your Voting Power?
pageHelp.answer11: Every ADA holder has an amount of Voting Power equal to the amount of Lovelace they have in a wallet. When you link a wallet containing ADA to GovTool, GovTool will read the ADA balance in the wallet, and make it available to you to use as Voting Power. Voting Power can be used in several ways: Delegate your Voting Power to a DRep, How to delegate your Voting Power.
pageHelp.answer12: For ada holders voting power refers to the amount of ada they own. For registered DReps Voting Power refers to both to the voting power they own and to the voting power that other ada holders have delegated to them.
pageHelp.answer13: We define seven different types of governance actions. A governance action is an on-chain event that is triggered by a transaction and has a deadline after which it cannot be enacted.
